Posts.Content: I want to tell you guys that my solid rock through this has been these forums. The internet is a vast volume of information. Listening to what you guys have been through lets me know I can make it what ever the out come. I will keep all of you posted.
Posts.Title: Looking for help !!!

Posts.Content: First of all I would like to thank all that gave me advise. The help and support all of you offer is beyond the thanks I can give back, I went to Dana Farber for a second opinion. Met with the head of their urology department. My gleason score is 3+4=7 a little worse than I was first told but he said that this was nothing to worry about. My CT scans and Chest Xrays turned out to be clear. Ditigal rectal exam showed nothing. His advise was also surgery. He said that I am too young for most other options and that it was better to work for a cure. Not something I will still have to worry about later. I am going Thursday 9/13 for my pre op consolt. After that I will get my surgury date. Still scared to death but if i continue forward death will have to wait. I guess I will see you on the other side !!!!
Posts.Title: Looking for help !!!

Posts.Title: Looking for help !!!

Posts.Content: Hello, I'm going out of my mind with fear. My first PSA was 6 waited three months then 7.2. Docter asked why I didn't see a urlolgist this could be cancer then I freaked. Seen urlolgist on his recomendation I got a biopsy. Two of the twelve cores positive at a 5 on the gleason scale. He now wants to remove my prostate. I know I have other options. Is this the best treatment ? I'm 47 years old.
Posts.Title: Looking for help !!!

Posts.Content: My wife is picking up Patrick Walsh's book today, I have seen in the forums the book seemed very important. My doctor said that my gleason was a 5 he did not break it down. I don't understand the (3+2=5) or what that means or what I actually am. I know he said two out of the twelve cores were positive for cancer low grade. Granted slow moving but I'm 47. The doctor had mentioned that any cancer has about a 15 year growth rate. Do I wait until it worsens or get it removed now. I've looked at radation and freezing I don't know if either is good. Since I've been told this it has taken over every thought process my wife or my self have. I read here and even if the scores are low the smart thing seems to remove the prostate before the cancer grows. Originally Posted by Fairwind KLA, before we can offer advise and help, you need to clarify your Gleason score.. Gleason 5 (3+2=5 or 2+3=5) is seldom if ever reported as being positive for cancer. Few if any urologists would recommend surgery...But if ONE of the grades in your Gleason score is a 5, (4+5=9) then that is serious. You can get a copy of your biopsy report from your doctor simply by asking for one. If you have indeed tested positive for PC, now would be a good time to read "Guide to Surviving Prostate Cancer" by Patrick Walsh. Try and get the newest (third) edition..
